subject: Investing
title: Regret Aversion and Missed Moves
description: A 60-second lesson on Regret Aversion and Missed Moves.

hook.text: An investor passed on buying Amazon in 2010. Years later, the regret kept her from investing at all.

buildup.text: Regret aversion makes you avoid decisions that might cause future regret, even profitable ones.

discovery.text: People regret actions more than inaction in the short term, but inaction more in the long term.

twist.text: The fear of making a wrong move can paralyze you into the worst move of all: doing nothing.

climax.text: Accepting that some decisions will be wrong frees you to make the many that will be right.

punchline.text: Regret the things you didn't do. They cost more in the end.

quiz.question: What does regret aversion cause?
options: Avoiding decisions to prevent future regret
